title: University Relational Algebra Practice
description: Thirty practice queries that cover the major relational algebra operators on the university schema.

questions.prompt: List the names of all students majoring in Computer Science.

solution.sql: SELECT name FROM student WHERE dept_name = 'Comp. Sci.';

questions.prompt: Find the ids and names of students with at least 90 total credits.

solution.sql: SELECT id, name FROM student WHERE tot_cred >= 90;

questions.prompt: Retrieve all information for students whose total credits are below 30.

solution.sql: SELECT * FROM student WHERE tot_cred < 30;

questions.prompt: Show the distinct majors represented by the students.

solution.sql: SELECT DISTINCT dept_name FROM student;

questions.prompt: List the departments that have either students or instructors.

solution.sql: SELECT dept_name FROM student UNION SELECT dept_name FROM instructor;

questions.prompt: Find departments that currently have courses but no instructors.

solution.sql: SELECT dept_name FROM course EXCEPT SELECT dept_name FROM instructor;

questions.prompt: Return the departments that have at least one student and at least one instructor.

solution.sql: SELECT dept_name FROM student INTERSECT SELECT dept_name FROM instructor;

questions.prompt: Rename the student relation so that id becomes student_id and dept_name becomes major.

solution.sql: SELECT id AS student_id, name, dept_name AS major, tot_cred FROM student;

questions.prompt: List each course along with its title and the budget of the offering department.

solution.sql: SELECT c.course_id, c.title, d.budget AS dept_budget FROM course AS c NATURAL JOIN department AS d;

questions.prompt: Find the sections offered in Fall 2009 along with the rooms they occupy using an explicit join condition.

solution.relational_algebra: pi{course_id, sec_id, sec_building, sec_room}( rho{building->sec_building, room_number->sec_room}(sigma{semester = 'Fall' AND year = 2009}(section)) ⋈{sec_building = class_building AND sec_room = class_room} rho{building->class_building, room_number->class_room}(classroom) )
solution.sql:
SELECT s.course_id, s.sec_id, s.building AS sec_building, s.room_number AS sec_room
FROM section AS s
JOIN classroom AS c ON s.building = c.building AND s.room_number = c.room_number
WHERE s.semester = 'Fall' AND s.year = 2009;

questions.prompt: Produce student-course pairs where the student majors in the same department that offers the course using a Cartesian product.

solution.relational_algebra: pi{student_name, course_title}(sigma{student_major = course_dept}( rho{name->student_name, dept_name->student_major}(student) × rho{title->course_title, dept_name->course_dept}(course) ))

questions.prompt: List student names with their advisors' names.

solution.relational_algebra: pi{student_name, advisor_name}( rho{id->s_id, name->student_name}(student) ⋈ advisor ⋈ rho{id->i_id, name->advisor_name}(instructor) )
solution.sql:
SELECT st.name AS student_name, inst.name AS advisor_name
FROM student AS st
JOIN advisor AS adv ON st.id = adv.s_id
JOIN instructor AS inst ON adv.i_id = inst.id;

questions.prompt: Find the student-course pairs where the grade is A.

solution.sql: SELECT id, course_id, sec_id, semester, year FROM takes WHERE grade = 'A';

questions.prompt: Return the course id and title for courses that have at least one prerequisite.

solution.sql:
SELECT DISTINCT c.course_id, c.title
FROM course AS c JOIN prereq AS p ON c.course_id = p.course_id;

questions.prompt: Find students who have not taken any course.

solution.sql:
SELECT id, name FROM student
EXCEPT
SELECT DISTINCT st.id, st.name
FROM student AS st
JOIN takes AS t ON st.id = t.id;

questions.prompt: Find student-course pairs where the student earned an A or a B.

solution.relational_algebra: pi{id, course_id, sec_id, semester, year}(sigma{grade = 'A'}(takes)) UNION pi{id, course_id, sec_id, semester, year}(sigma{grade = 'B'}(takes))

questions.prompt: Return the ids of people who appear as both a student and an instructor.

solution.sql: SELECT id FROM student INTERSECT SELECT id FROM instructor;

questions.prompt: Show each section together with the meeting day and start time.

solution.relational_algebra: pi{course_id, sec_id, semester, year, day, start_hr, start_min}(section ⋈ time_slot)

questions.prompt: Report the course and section identifiers that were offered in Fall 2009 but not in Spring 2010.

solution.relational_algebra: pi{course_id, sec_id}(sigma{semester = 'Fall' AND year = 2009}(section)) - pi{course_id, sec_id}(sigma{semester = 'Spring' AND year = 2010}(section))

questions.prompt: Rename the prerequisite relation so that course_id becomes main_course and prereq_id becomes required_course.

solution.sql: SELECT course_id AS main_course, prereq_id AS required_course FROM prereq;

questions.prompt: Find the ids of students who have taken every Computer Science course (may be empty).

solution.sql:
SELECT t.id
FROM takes AS t
WHERE t.course_id IN (SELECT course_id FROM course WHERE dept_name = 'Comp. Sci.')
GROUP BY t.id
HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT t.course_id) = (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM course WHERE dept_name = 'Comp. Sci.');

questions.prompt: List the building and room numbers of classrooms with capacity at least 80.

solution.sql: SELECT building, room_number FROM classroom WHERE capacity >= 80;

questions.prompt: List instructors who earn more than 90,000 along with their departments.
Find the ids and names of students that are not assigned an advisor.

solution.sql:
SELECT st.id, st.name
FROM student AS st
LEFT JOIN advisor AS adv ON st.id = adv.s_id
WHERE adv.s_id IS NULL;

questions.prompt: Retrieve the names of instructors who taught during Spring 2010.

solution.sql:
SELECT DISTINCT inst.name AS instructor_name
FROM instructor AS inst
JOIN teaches AS te ON inst.id = te.id
WHERE te.semester = 'Spring' AND te.year = 2010;

questions.prompt: List the courses (id and title) that have no prerequisites.

solution.sql:
SELECT c.course_id, c.title
FROM course AS c
LEFT JOIN prereq AS p ON c.course_id = p.course_id
WHERE p.course_id IS NULL;

questions.prompt: Find student-advisor pairs where both are in the same department.

solution.relational_algebra: pi{student_name, advisor_name}(sigma{student_major = advisor_major}( rho{id->s_id, name->student_name, dept_name->student_major}(student) ⋈ advisor ⋈ rho{id->i_id, name->advisor_name, dept_name->advisor_major}(instructor) ))
solution.sql:
SELECT st.name AS student_name, inst.name AS advisor_name
FROM student AS st
JOIN advisor AS adv ON st.id = adv.s_id
JOIN instructor AS inst ON adv.i_id = inst.id
WHERE st.dept_name = inst.dept_name;

questions.prompt: Return ids of students who have earned both an A and a B in different courses.
List student-course combinations where the student did not receive an F.

solution.relational_algebra: pi{id, course_id, sec_id, semester, year}(takes) - pi{id, course_id, sec_id, semester, year}(sigma{grade = 'F'}(takes))

questions.prompt: Find departments that currently do not offer any course.
